column2: When must  Engine Anti-Ice be used during Ground, Climb, and Cruise operations?
column3:
ENGINE ANTI-ICE MUST BE ON WHEN:
GROUND OPERATIONS
• Icing conditions exist
OR
• Icing conditions are anticipated
AND
CLIMB & CRUISE
• Icing conditions exist
OR
• Icing conditions are anticipated
EXCEPTION:
During climb and cruise, EAI may be OFF when SAT is below −40°C.

column2: When must Engine Anti-Ice be used during descent?
column3:
ENGINE ANTI-ICE MUST BE ON:
DESCENT
• When icing conditions exist
OR
• When icing conditions are anticipated
NOTE: This requirement applies even when SAT is below −40°C.

column2: What is the Max-8 Caution for the use of Engine Anti-Ice?
column3:
CAUTION
Do NOT operate Engine Anti-Ice (EAI) in-flight when not in actual or anticipated icing conditions.
Reason:
Operation of EAI outside actual/anticipated icing conditions may result in severe engine inlet damage or failure.
